[@punkmonk](@EaYYQo5nAQRabB9nxAn5i2uiIZ665b90Qk2U/WHNVE8=.ed25519) 

Yeah! I've thought about this a few times before, but apparently I just needed another poke. I've implemented [a basic prototype](https://gitlab.com/christianbundy/ssb-blob-content/merge_requests/1) on top of ssb-blob-content. It's slow and janky and downloads any Dat identifier from a message that looks like this:

```json
{ 
  "type": "dat",
  "dat": "dat://43dfc9f23fdded8cc7c01c71c0702a0529130af0258e7fb30bf5a0a3f73d69b3/index.html"
}
```

I've posted a message like that [here](%cZXfESpjBJg63UrN2rNv7aiAQLTKCrIc5BONml6cWN0=.sha256), but I haven't tested it in any real clients.
